title: Introduction to ASL and American Deaf Culture
description: Students learn ASL to communicate in everyday interactions by engaging in small group conversations. Covers key linguistic structures, including sentence types, movement, space, facial expressions, and fingerspelling. Students discover the American deaf culture, including deaf history, diversity within today’s deaf community, iconic roots of signs, international signs used in the global deaf community, and techniques of ASL storytelling. Prerequisites: no prior study of ASL.
